subject: TXCL
title: Directed Rsch in Tox
info: special project that addresses specific issue in toxicology. under guidance of faculty member.

subject: TXCL
title: Principles of Tox
info: introduction to fundamentals of poisoning in individuals and the environment, assessment of potential health hazards, and application of toxicology in various professional careers.
prereqInfo: grad txcl major or instr consent

subject: TXCL
title: Priciples of Toxicology
info: science of toxicology. biomedical principles. regulatory practices governing protection of human health and environmental quality.
prereqInfo: at least one semester [biochemistry, calculus, cell biology]; at least one semester of [human or animal] physiology recommended

subject: TXCL
title: Chemical Toxicology
info: signs, symptoms, and mechanism of toxicity of different classes of chemicals spanning several organ systems, including chemical carcinogenesis.

subject: TXCL
title: NanoToxicology
info: introduction to science of nanotoxicology. nanotechnology in scientific research. assessment of impact on biological systems.

subject: TXCL
title: Vet Tox
info: toxicology of minerals, pesticides, venoms, and various toxins. identification of poisonous plants. recognition, diagnosis, and treatment of animal poisons.

subject: TXCL
title: Intro to Regulatory Medicine
info: explanation of products requiring pre-market approval and those that may be marketed without approval. post-market surveillance. adverse reactions, removal of product from market.

subject: TXCL
title: Advanced Tox I
info: absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion of xenobiotics; toxicokinetics; mechanisms of toxicity or specific classes of chemical agents.
prereqInfo: 5011 or bioc 4331, pubh 5104 or instr consent

subject: TXCL
title: Advanced Tox II
info: kinetic and dynamic determinants of target organ toxicity; pathological alterations in structure/function relationships for major target organ systems; mechanisms of mutagenesis, carcinogenesis, and teratogenesis.
prereqInfo: 8012, bioc 4332, phsl 5062 or phsl 6101 or instr consent

subject: TXCL
title: Investigative Tox
info: evaluating toxicology research issues and literature.

subject: TXCL
title: FTE: Master's
prereqInfo: master's student, adviser and dgs consent

subject: TXCL
title: FTE: Doctoral
prereqInfo: doctoral student, adviser and dgs consent

subject: TXCL
title: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr
prereqInfo: doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: TXCL
title: Thesis Credit:Mast*
prereqInfo: max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [plan a only]

subject: TXCL
title: Thesis Credit:Doct*
prereqInfo: max 18 cr per semester or summer; 24 cr required
